reviewText:
Legends of the Bible is a good series.  Will work as an addition to Bible story time in
a children's church or VBS setting.

Although my 5 year old grandson was impatient for Charleton Heston's recap of the story to be over (which I enjoyed), once the cartoon portion began, he was enthralled.  Good animation and a story well told.  Could have done without the hokey song about dreams, which was repeated throughout.
Charlton Heston did a great job with the introduction of the movie!! The movie itself is touching and inspiring. This movies should be viewed by all ages. Families required!!!

My wife and I got this one for our child, and it's loved my the family we watch it over and over. It is best to view all programs with young children, because no matter how innocent a DVD may seem children always have questions that are best answered by their parents. "Faith without works is dead" so do not leave the education of your child to the television, teach them the way God would.

This DVD production of the Joseph & The Coat of Many Colors story has accomplished exactly what I had hoped for my 3yr old son: an interest in learning about the Lord and His involvement in the lives of those who trust Him.  My son often recites (in surprising detail) various scenes from the tale.  One of my fellow brothers in Christ calls my son "The Little Preacher" because my son enjoys capturing the attention of those around him so he can retell the story of Joseph & The Coat of Many Colors.  I understand some reviewing this telling of the story may prefer stricter adherence to various nuances and literary exactness from Scripture - I can appreciate that as I am a literal believer of Scripture.  There is never a perfect retelling of any Biblical story that will appeal to everyone's preference.  As already mentioned, this achieved what I had hoped for my son: help him develop an interest in learning about the Lord, building a faith in the Lord, and forgiving those who wrong him.

This is my favorite story in Genesis.  This cartoon version is just perfect for kids or adults.  The story is first introduced by Charlton Heston.  If the kids start looking around for other things to do, don't worry. The introduction is brief, but it's a good one followed by the cute animated story of Joseph and his coat of many colours which everyone will love.  My friend's son was only 2 when he watched part of this and he was glued to it!  The characters are cute and all of the Heroes and Legends videos are told in a way that it easy for a child to understand.
Great for bible study
great for my Sunday school class
my son loves it
grand kids like them
my kids love them
Great
Very good for children pre-teen age
Great bible story for kids!
Purchased for Sunday School summer program.. Ages K-5.  Story pretty much sticks to Bible story.
great way to tell the bible stories for the younger kids. My grandchildren loved watching the movie. Going to buy more of the dvds. Charles Heston did a great job telling these stories.

I was excited to receive the collection of 12 such stories from a local store for only $5 for Christmas.  The kids love watching these, but unfortunately, I'm not loving them.  I like that someone has invested the time and money to put Bible stories at a child's level, but sadly, they take rather questionable "liberties", my guess is so they can fill in some "blanks" to round out a story put to film.  You can't say what Scripture doesn't say, though, so I cringe and try to make sure to let the kids know that "we don't know that it really happened that way", or "I don't think they were angry like that", because yes, the characters in these stories often appear/sound mean/angry.  I heard another family member preview them on-line and she already had made the same "angry" observation about the characters.

There are also story introductions with Mr. Heston, which tend to be too long for many kids to sit through.  They again, seem to "interpret" and don't always seem like good theology...sighs.  2 stars for providing Bible stories for kiddos, but outside of that, I'm pretty disappointed and I don't like to be negative :(.
The sunday school class loved it!! middle and high schooler and they did not want me to cut it off

I am a new Christian. Born again!
I just recently was at a bible study and was able to put an image, albeit animated, to the story we were discussing!
How cool is that!
Reading Potters House Church. It's where it's at!

Thank you so much for getting this item to us promptly, in adequate time for us to give it to our great-grandson for his birthday.  The packaging and mailing conditions were excellent.  Thank you, again.  Great job!

This is a wonderful means to help children visually see a Bible story come to life and learn while enjoying the beautiful color and wonderful sound quality.  a great purchase....a must for a Christian household with children.
Thank you for your blessing to us.  Thank you for spreading the gospel this way.  God Bless you. Keep up the good work.
Never too early to start teaching our children about their Savior and Redeemer as we all need to know of Him! That we may bow before Him and confess He is The Christ.
Using this video as a Christmas present for the kids. Although I haven't seen this video yet, I'm sure it will be a great addition to the other videos that we already own from this series.

I ordered severeal of these to show to my kids.  As we read each story I wanted to show them the movie behind it.  The kids enjoyed these very much and at a inexpensive cost, it is definitely worth it.  It's very engaging and can allow for much interaction with the kids.

My children enjoyed this video. This is a fairly well done cartoon telling the story of Joseph.

My complaint is in changing the details, particularly of Joseph's second dream.  Genesis 37:9 in NIV translation says: Then he had another dream, and he told it to his brothers.  "Listen," he said, "I had another dream, and this time the sun and moon and eleven stars were bowing down to me.

In this video, Joseph tells his father that the dream showed stars bowing down to the sun.  There are other changes which seem to have been made to make the story flow more easily, but I cannot figure out why they felt the need to change this detail.  In the Bible, Jacob says, "Will your mother and I and your brothers actually come and bow down to the ground before you?"  This is consistent with the dream of the sun and the moon and 11 stars bowing down to Joseph.

Video is still entertaining, but I would recommend reviewing the bible story first and discussing the differences with your children, if you want them to have an accurate knowledge of this biblical story.
These DVD's are easy to understand and to teach children with.
My Sunday School class Loves it
Grandson loves!
it was a gift haven't watched it myself
love it
Not 100% biblically accurate, but the kids get the jist and it is well done.
good
nice
Kids love it and I do too

The interpretation of the exchange between Joseph and Potiphar's wife felt so wrong. Rather than Joseph fleeing from temptation, he lingered and was so close to giving in.  It not only felt wrong, but it sends a message to kids that one should stick around for a while when temptation comes, including adultery.
